CheckTitle: Ensure DMARC Records Exist for All Domains
Description: Checks if all domains in DKIM configuration have a valid DMARC TXT record.
Risk: If DMARC records are missing, your domains are more susceptible to email spoofing, phishing, and lack of reporting on fraudulent email activity.

Code.CLI: Add a TXT record to your domain's DNS with the value: v=DMARC1; p=quarantine; rua=mailto:dmarc-reports@yourdomain.com
Code.Other: 1. Go to your DNS provider. 2. Add or update the TXT record for DMARC as recommended by Microsoft 365. 3. Ensure it includes 'v=DMARC1; p=quarantine' or a stricter policy.

Recommendation.Text: Ensure all domains used for email have a valid DMARC TXT record.

Notes: This check validates that all domains in DKIM configuration have a valid DMARC TXT record.
